solution.text:
The zero of \(_{m}_x+_{n}_\,\) is \(_{{Fraction (-n,m)}}_\).
Substituting zero of \(g(x)\,\) in \(p(x)\,\), we get,
\(p(_{{Fraction (-n,m)}}_)=(_{j}_ \times _{{Fraction (-n,m)}}_) - (_{k}_ \times (_{{Fraction (-n,m)}}_)^3) + _{l}_\)
\(\Rightarrow p(_{{Fraction (-n,m)}}_)=_{{j*Fraction(-n,m)}}_-(_{{k*Fraction(-n,m)*Fraction(-n,m)*Fraction(-n,m)}}_) + _{l}_\)
\(\Rightarrow p(_{{Fraction(-n,m)}}_)=_{{j*Fraction(-n,m)-k*Fraction(-n,m)*Fraction(-n,m)*Fraction(-n,m) + l}}_\)
Therefore, the remainder when \(p(x)\) is divided by \(g(x)\) is \(_{{j*Fraction(-n,m)-k*Fraction(-n,m)*Fraction(-n,m)*Fraction(-n,m) + l}}_\)
